subject: Re: [junit] Test fails when run alone but passes when run together with others!
msgSnippet: Morten, I would look how big your tests are.. The lighter they are (rarely more than ten to tweny lines of code), you may -but still very unlikely - have found
messageBody:
Morten,

I would look how big your tests are..
The lighter they are (rarely more than ten to tweny lines of code), you
may -but still very unlikely - have found something wrong in JUnit (nothing
personnal here :-)) ). If you have tests bigger than that the probability
that you test are not independat from one each other is almost 100 %. You
should therefore consider you tests as failing, thus !

Thomas,

--

Thomas SMETS
rue J. Wytsmanstraat 62
1050 Brussel - Bruxelles
yahoo-id : smetsthomas
----- Original Message -----
From: "Morten Grum" <mg@...>
To: "JunitList" <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, January 18, 2002 1:02 PM
Subject: [junit] Test fails when run alone but passes when run together with
others!


> Hi all,
>
> I have a TestCase for which one of its tests fails when the TestCase is
run
> alone but passes when the test is run together with other TestCases (in my
> AllTests).
>
> I was under the impression that JUnit tests ran very independently so that
> something like this could never happen. What could I be doing wrong? Where
> should I look? Any tips.
>
> If this questions been up several times just give me a tip on what to look
> for in the archive.
>
> Thanks in advance.
>
> Morten
>
